56. Paramater: Effective area¶

class optcom.parameters.fiber.effective_area.EffectiveArea(core_radius=5.0, NA=0.1)¶

Effective area, currently only for single mode.

Parameters

core_radius (float) -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

static calc_effective_area(omega, core_radius=5.0, NA=None, n_core=None, n_clad=None)¶

Calculate the effective area (for now only single mode). 4

Parameters

  • omega -- The angular frequency. \([rad\cdot ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture.

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core.

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding.

Returns

Value of the effective area. \([\mu m^2]\)

Notes

Considering:

\[A_{eff} = \pi w^2 = \pi \big(a(0.616 + 1.66V^{-\frac{2}{3}} + 0.987V^{-6})\big)^2\]

References

4

Govind Agrawal, Chapter 2: Pulse Propagation in Fibers, Nonlinear Fiber Optics (Fifth Edition), Academic Press, 2013, Page 34.

57. Parameter: Non-linear coefficient¶

class optcom.parameters.fiber.nl_coefficient.NLCoefficient(nl_index, eff_area)¶
Parameters

  • nl_index (Union[float, Array, Callable]) -- The non linear index. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\)

  • eff_erea -- The effective area. \([\mu m^2]\)

static calc_nl_coefficient(omega, nl_index, eff_area)¶

Calculate the non linear parameter. 2

Parameters

  • omega -- The center angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non linear refractive index. \([m^{2}\cdot W^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective mode area. \([\mu m^{2}]\)

Returns

Value of the non linear parameter. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\)

Notes

\[\gamma(\omega_0) = \frac{\omega_0 n_2}{c A_{eff}}\]

References

2

Govind Agrawal, Chapter 2: Pulse Propaga(omega_0)tion in Fibers, Nonlinear Fiber Optics (Fifth Edition), Academic Press, 2013, Page 38.

58. Parameter: Overlap factor¶

class optcom.parameters.fiber.overlap_factor.OverlapFactor(doped_area)¶
Parameters

doped_area (float) -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\)

static calc_overlap_factor(doped_area, eff_area)¶

Calculate the overlap factor.

Parameters

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\mu m^2]\)

Returns

Value of the overlap factor.

Notes

Considering:

\[\Gamma = 1 - e^{-2\frac{A_{doped}}{A_{eff}}}\]

59. Parameter: V fiber parameter¶

class optcom.parameters.fiber.v_para.V(core_radius=5.0, NA=None, n_core=None, n_clad=None)¶
Parameters

  • omega -- The angular frequency. \([rad\cdot ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius (float) -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • NA (Optional[float]) -- The numerical aperture.

  • n_core (float or numpy.ndarray of float) -- The refractive index of the core.

  • n_clad (Optional[float]) -- The refractive index of the cladding.

static calc_V(omega, core_radius=5.0, NA=None, n_core=None, n_clad=None)¶

Calculate the V parameter.

Parameters

  • omega -- The angular frequency. \([rad\cdot ps^{-1}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture.

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core.

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding.

Returns

Value of the V parameter.

Notes

Considering:

\[V = k_0 a \text{NA} = \frac{\omega_0}{c} a \text{NA} = \frac{\omega_0}{c} a (n_{co}^2 - n_{cl}^2)^{\frac{1}{2}}\]
